name: Budget Backpackers

reviews.title: Good Hostel - just a few small issues!
reviews.text: Good hostel, good location and good staff. Our twin private room was very good hostel room.

reviews.title: Loved my stay
reviews.text: All thats needed is some new mattresses and some hooks in the showers!!!!!!

reviews.title: Best... Hostel... Ever!!!
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights May 2006 a loved my stay!

reviews.title: The Good, the Bad, The Downright Ugly of it
reviews.text: Great location less then a 10 minute walk to eveything , train, airport bus, castle, and new town shopping.

reviews.title: Issues
reviews.text: The hostel itself was great clean rooms, comfy beds. I stayed in a four person dorm that was clean and quite big, nice hardwood floors, bright colours, and lockers.

reviews.title: Amazing - clean, cheap, and nice. Left Castle Rock to come here.
reviews.text: This is the nicest hostel I've ever stayed in. We arrived in Edinburgh and got a room at Castle Rock, and then promptly left because it was nasty (see my Castle Rock review). We went right down the street and found Budget Backpackers. For about the same price, we got a room for 4 instead of 14, and it was actually clean.

reviews.title: Cool atmosphere
reviews.text: Everything here was very nice. It was very clean, there wwas plenty of room in the kiychen, heck, it even had plasma TVs.

reviews.title: Nice, clean hostel
reviews.text: The only problem that we had at all was that there was only one washer and dryer. But we managed to find somewhere else to do it, so it wasn't a real problem.

reviews.title: Loved it, awesome hostel
reviews.text: All in all, I would absolutely recommend a stay here. Don't be fooled by the other places.

reviews.title: Best hostel i have ever stayed in.
reviews.text: Me and the boyfriend stayed at Budget Backpackers at the beginning of the month. We booked a private room, which was pretty large, with a lovely, comfortable double bed, as well as nice and warm considering the cold early Feb weather outside! We had a gorgeous bathroom next to our room, which was very popular with the other residents due to the fact that it seemed to be one of the only ones on our floor without a huge window, letting all the freezing air and nosy neighbours' looks in!

I just got back from a few nights here. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great too. I would highly recommend this hostel. They give free city tours and organize pub crawls most evenings.
reviews.title: Great hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hostel was GREAT, if you don't mind the bright colour scheme! We had a double room (sadly no double bed), which was very clean and in a quiet part of the hostel. The toilets and showers were always clean, and the breakfast was cheap and adequate (although be warned, they really pack up quick at the end). Give the muffins / pastries a miss though - they're dried out and not too tasty. We were there during the Edinburgh Festival, so the whole place was buzzing and yet we could still get a great night's sleep. Everything was within easy walking distance, and the friendly staff were great for directions when needed. Would definitely stay there again - if we can every afford to get over to Scotland again!!
reviews.title: Incredibly fabulous location, great hostel

reviews.text: We (4 girls mid 20yrs-early 30yrs) stayed 1 night on a Saturday
reviews.title: great location and place to stay

reviews.text: We choose it due to previous reviews, location. We were not backpacking, just wanted somewhere reasonably priced, central and clean for 1 night... here we got all 3.
reviews.title: Great Staff and a Fun Place!

description: With over 250 beds, and located in the heart of beautiful Old Town, Budget Backpackers is one of the best places to stay in Edinburgh! All of the amenities you need including free linen, free hot showers, a self catering kitchen, and a bar/cafe! Budget Backpackers is one of the best located hostels in the city, being only a 10 minute walk from Waverly Train Station, a 2 minute walk from the Royal Mile, and the breathtaking Edinburgh Castle practically on our doorstep! There is also always something happening within the hostel, with weekly Wii and Pool Competitions, Quiz and Movie Nights, Free Walking Tours 11am daily Monday to Saturday, and our infamous Pub Crawls Monday to Friday kicking off in our very own bar! Whether you want to see the sights, make friends, party it up, or just relax, Budget Backpackers has everything you need to make your stay in Edinburgh memorable!
